q: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.
h:
“I dream my painting and I paint my dream.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Not why the addiction but why the pain.
h:
“Not why the addiction but why the pain.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.
h:
“Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Pain doesn't last. And when it's gone, we have something to show for it. Growth.
h:
“Pain doesn't last. And when it's gone, we have something to show for it. Growth.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
h:
“The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Life may be full of pain but that's not an excuse to give up.
h:
“Life may be full of pain but that's not an excuse to give up.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
h:
“Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Music is like creating an emotional painting. The sounds are the colors.
h:
“Music is like creating an emotional painting. The sounds are the colors.” —
Yanni

q: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
h:
“Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Turn the pain into power.
h:
“Turn the pain into power.” —
Unknown

q: There is no self-discovery without pain and loss.
h:
“There is no self-discovery without pain and loss.” —
Anita Krizzan

q: Time doesn't heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
h:
“Time doesn't heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: There's no coming to consciousness without pain
h:
“There's no coming to consciousness without pain” —
Carl Jung

q: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
h:
“Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure.
h:
“Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.
h:
“Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
h:
“Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.” —
Denis Waitley

q: The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.
h:
“The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
h:
“Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.
h:
“Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
h:
“We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.
h:
“Getting over a painful experience is much like crossing monkey bars. You have to let go at some point in order to move forward.” —
Unknown

q: Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise man to be able to sell it.
h:
“Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise man to be able to sell it.” —
Samuel Butler

q: You can suffer the pain of change or suffer remaining the way you are.
h:
“You can suffer the pain of change or suffer remaining the way you are.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
h:
“A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.” —
Criss Jami

q: You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.
h:
“You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.” —
Alexander Pope

q: Learning is a gift, even when pain is your teacher.
h:
“Learning is a gift, even when pain is your teacher.” —
Michael Jordan

q: How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.
h:
“How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Change happens when the pain of holding on becomes greater than the fear of letting go.
h:
“Change happens when the pain of holding on becomes greater than the fear of letting go.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.
h:
“Given the choice between the experience of pain and nothing, I would choose pain.” —
William Faulkner

q: Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.
h:
“Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.
h:
“New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.
h:
“Nothing in this world is worth having or worth doing unless it means effort, pain, difficulty.” —
Theodore Roosevelt
